span.title: dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a UTC offset SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

span.title: Imaging study model includes the key information about the content of an imaging study. It does not include image pixels but includes location pointers to its image content and organises this information according to the well-established model of an imaging study made of one or more series and each series made of instances or images. Composed of a set of data (DICOM KOS) that facilitates the location of all available images.

description.value: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

short.value: Observation model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

short.value: Basic metadata for this information

definition.value: Basic metadata for this information

short.value: Patient who is receiving health care. This patient might be different from the direct subject of the observation.

definition.value: Patient/subject information

short.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

short.value: Status of the resource or document

definition.value: Status of the resource or document

short.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

definition.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

short.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

definition.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

short.value: The direct subject of the observation if different from the patient (subject of care), e.g. an observation of an implanted device. Additional types of subject may be allowed in implementations.

definition.value: The direct subject of the observation if different from the patient (subject of care), e.g. an observation of an implanted device. Additional types of subject may be allowed in implementations.

short.value: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation

definition.value: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation

short.value: Observation type. Code and name representing the type of the observation using the agreed code systems.

definition.value: Observation type. Code and name representing the type of the observation using the agreed code systems.

short.value: Observation method

definition.value: Observation method (measurement principle) to obtain the result.

definition.value: Specimen used for this observation.

short.value: Performer of the observation. Some test could be performed by the patient himself or by a care giver. Those are in the scope of this deliverable under specified conditions.

short.value: Anatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.

short.value: Result of the observation including text, numeric, coded, and other types of results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

definition.value: Result of the observation including text, numeric, coded, and other types of results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

short.value: Observation result value according to the type of observation. Model covers only most frequently used data types but other data types can be used as well. Text result value should be used only if coded result value is not expected otherwise use valueCodeableConcept.text. For Quantity, Range and Ratio, result units of the measurement should be provided.

definition.value: Observation result value according to the type of observation. Model covers only most frequently used data types but other data types can be used as well. short.value: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to.

definition.value: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race. Multiple appliesTo are interpreted as an \"AND\" of the target populations.

short.value: Text based reference range in an observation.

definition.value: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation. An example would be a reference value of \"Negative\" or a list or table of \"normals\".
